Posts.EditableText:
Thought I'd start this so that folk can link to recommended TA/Parser games.

I don't want to sound snobbish in any way, but if you could restrict your recommendations to Text Adventure/Parser, that would be appreciated.
Posts.HTML:

Posts.EditableText: You're interested in Quest games only, I assume?
Posts.HTML: You're interested in Quest games only, I assume?

Posts.EditableText: I haven't played many tbh, but the very first one I ever played on here (coincidentally called First Times) probably remains my favourite. http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ ... irst-times
Posts.HTML:
I haven't played many tbh, but the very first one I ever played on here (coincidentally called First Times) probably remains my favourite.

http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ ... irst-times

Posts.EditableText: I will obviously recommend mine http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ ... -and-ruler I like to see gaining XP, doing combat and shopping and I do not really find it on TA and so I try to make some myself. Having said that, I did enjoy Jungle Queen - it is also a unique concept: http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ ... ngle-queen Empire of the sinking sun was enjoyable and implements elements I like to see in an adventure text game: http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ ... inking-sun - You do have to use pen, paper and a dice - I would like to see that just all included with the game though First Times was OK for me, but I prefer adventure. The Luna Stone had some good puzzles and was well written: http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ ... -lunastone
Posts.HTML:
I will obviously recommend mine http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ ... -and-ruler
I like to see gaining XP, doing combat and shopping and I do not really find it on TA and so I try to make some myself.

Having said that, I did enjoy Jungle Queen - it is also a unique concept: http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ ... ngle-queen
Empire of the sinking sun was enjoyable and implements elements I like to see in an adventure text game: http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ ... inking-sun - You do have to use pen, paper and a dice - I would like to see that just all included with the game though
First Times was OK for me, but I prefer adventure.
The Luna Stone had some good puzzles and was well written: http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ ... -lunastone

Posts.EditableText: [quote="Silver":9um9waga]I haven't played many tbh, but the very first one I ever played on here (coincidentally called First Times) probably remains my favourite. http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ ... irst-times[/quote:9um9waga] Just had a go on that and I did feel it grabbing me in the same way the ones I used to play as a teenager did. Unfortunately, It has one very annoying element, and that is the 'clang' that loops every so often, scrolls the page down while you're trying to read the description of the opening room. I was trying to find a way out of there, considering all the options, and then suddenly the page scrolls down because a 'clang' had been printed. I never got out of there, and would probably have persevered if I hadn't needed to keep scrolling back up to read the room description again.
Posts.HTML:
Silver wrote:I haven't played many tbh, but the very first one I ever played on here (coincidentally called First Times) probably remains my favourite.

http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ ... irst-times

Just had a go on that and I did feel it grabbing me in the same way the ones I used to play as a teenager did. Unfortunately, It has one very annoying element, and that is the 'clang' that loops every so often, scrolls the page down while you're trying to read the description of the opening room.

I was trying to find a way out of there, considering all the options, and then suddenly the page scrolls down because a 'clang' had been printed. I never got out of there, and would probably have persevered if I hadn't needed to keep scrolling back up to read the room description again.

Posts.EditableText:
you can type l (look) to get the description repeated. Or try and get out of the room a bit quicker. :p

It does lack a bit of polish but there's quite a lot of it done well.
